title: Too many dependencies?
body:
I've followed the instructions on http://github.jcabi.com/

I'm not using Maven, nor really interested in adding Maven as a dependency to my work.

On the JCabi page is mentioned that we only need to download one jar to get jcabi working. Afterwards I'm reading that some more dependencies are needed for runtime: http://github.jcabi.com/dependencies.html

I've downloaded each one that is mentioned manually but errors about missing dependencies persist. I then add all the dependencies mentioned on the page (those required for testing, compiling) and different errors but still not working.

At this point I download the most recent version of your code from github, get all the dependencies automatically from Maven but note the huge number of libraries that are needed for this project to work.

Would it be possible to provide a single (fat) jar with all dependencies included?

Second request: Perhaps possible to trim the non-used dependencies? For example, I see jars for interacting with twitter, don't know if these are really needed.

Ideally, end-developers not adopting Maven on their work would sincerely appreciate to simply download a jar file, include it as library and starting using your project.

In the current state, I'm unable to use the code.

Thanks for taking this request into consideration.

With kind regards,
Nuno Brito
